snippet: “Major differences” with the government of Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras were reported as creditors and Athens pursue a deal.
abstract: International Monetary Fund recalls negotiators from Greece, revealing deep acrimony and raising most serious threat yet that nation will default on its debts when current bailout funding runs out at the end of June; some experts say move may be part of negotiating strategy, but hardening stance at IMF, in Germany and elsewhere has made specter of Greece's exit from euro quite real.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and LANDON THOMAS Jr
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed from Paris and Landon Thomas Jr. from New York. Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens, James Kanter from Brussels, and Mikayla Bouchard from Washington.

lead_paragraph: “Major differences” with the government of Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras were reported as creditors and Athens pursue a deal.

headline.main: I.M.F. Recalls Negotiators as Deadline Looms for Greek Deal
